intro: Trichelostylis tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled spike rush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant is characterized by its cylindrical, four-angled stems and small, spike-like clusters of flowers. It typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, preferring moist, acidic soils. Trichelostylis tetragona plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
